intro: Eriocoelum pungens, commonly known as the spiny poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals, which are actually modified leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. Eriocoelum pungens typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and serrated leaves. It is cultivated for its ornamental value, particularly during the holiday season when its vibrant colors are displayed.
